metadata.title: CVE-2024-11168 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The urllib.parse.urlsplit() and urlparse() functions improperly validatedbracketed hosts (`[]`), allowing hosts that weren't IPv6 or IPvFuture. Thisbehavior was not conformant to RFC 3986 and potentially enabled SSRF if aURL is processed by more than one URL parser.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-11168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.12 - 3.12.3-1
libpython3.12-minimal - 3.12.3-1
libpython3.12-stdlib - 3.12.3-1
libpython3.12-testsuite - 3.12.3-1
libpython3.12t64 - 3.12.3-1
python3.12 - 3.12.3-1
python3.12-examples - 3.12.3-1
python3.12-full - 3.12.3-1
python3.12-minimal - 3.12.3-1
python3.12-nopie - 3.12.3-1
python3.12-venv - 3.12.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.12 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.3-1').
